data.field: unshift - prepend more elements to the beginning of a list

Does the opposite of a [perlfunc:shift|shift()]. Or the opposite of a [perlfunc:push|push()], depending on how you look at it. Prepends list to the front of the array, and returns the new number of elements in the array. 

    unshift(ARGV, '-e') unless $ARGV[0] =~ /^-/;

Note the LIST is prepended whole, not one element at a time, so the prepended elements stay in the same order. Use [perlfunc:reverse|reverse()] to do the reverse.
